did.unittitle: Henry Joel Cadbury papers related to the American Friends Service Committee

bioghist.p: Henry Joel Cadbury (1883-1974) was one of the founders of the American Friends Service Committee and served as its chair from 1921 to 1934 and from 1944 to 1960. He was professor of Biblical Literature at Bryn Mawr College from 1926 to 1934, and served as a trustee and director for many years. He was Chairman of the Board of Directors from 1956 to 1969. He also served on the faculties of Haverford and Harvard during his academic career.

scopecontent.p: The collection includes records related to the American Friends Service Committee's Committee on Family Planning and Population Education. The records are primarily related to a special report entitled "Who Shall Live? Man's Control over Birth and Death," which was published in 1970. There are also memoranda, reports, and correspondence from various family planning clinics and administrators in Asia, Latin America, and Africa.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
